etymology.description: semantic: 彡(彡) (shān, "hair-like stripes") + phonetic: 旡(旡) (jì) -> 彡 represents the shimmer or movement of a shadow, while 旡 contributes the sound
etymology.interpretation: 影(影) (yǐng, "shadow") visually combines 彡(彡) (shān, "hair-like stripes"), suggesting the motion or waviness of shadows, with 旡(旡) (jì) to provide the phonetic component. This unique combination successfully conveys the idea of a shadow or reflection due to its visual and auditory cues.

examples.chinese: 晚风轻拂(晚風輕拂)，窗影摇曳(窗影搖曳)。
examples.pinyin: Wǎn fēng qīng fú, chuāng yǐng yáo yè.
examples.english: The gentle evening breeze brushes, and the window shadows sway.

examples.chinese: 湖面倒影静谧(湖面倒影靜謐)。
examples.pinyin: Hú miàn dào yǐng jìng mì.

examples.chinese: 山影浮动(山影浮動)，云卷云舒(雲捲雲舒)。
examples.pinyin: Shān yǐng fú dòng, yún juǎn yún shū.
examples.english: The mountain shadows float, while the clouds roll and relax.
